content.text: is designed to add a new meter to an existing account within a billing system. It processes an exchange record identified by a sequence ID and ensures that the exchange code is '46', which is a specific code for this operation. The procedure performs several validation checks, inserts a new meter into the system, and updates tracking tables to reflect the addition. It also handles transaction management and error logging.

The procedure involves multiple validation checks, data retrieval, and insertion operations across different tables. It also includes transaction management and error handling, which adds to its complexity. However, the logic is straightforward and follows a linear flow, which keeps it from being classified as high complexity.
: The ID of the user executing the procedure, used for auditing purposes.
: The sequence ID of the exchange record to be processed.
: The exchange code, which must be '46' for this procedure.
: The current billing period in 'YYYYMM' format.
: An output parameter that shows the success (0) or failure (1) of the procedure.
Verify if the exchange record exists using
Check if the exchange record has already been processed.
is '46' and matches the record's exchange code.
Confirm the account exists and is active.
Ensure the meter number does not already exist in the system.
Retrieve account information related to the exchange.
Insert a new meter record into the
Retrieve the new meter's sequence ID.
Commit the transaction if all operations succeed.
Mark the exchange record as processed and update the reviewer ID.
Rollback the transaction if an error occurs and log the error details.
columns are indexed to optimize the
: The transaction scope is well-defined, but ensure that the operations within the transaction are as efficient as possible to minimize locking and blocking.
: Consider the impact of concurrent executions on the same exchange records or accounts, which leads to deadlocks or contention.
: If the procedure is interrupted or fails after inserting a meter but before updating the exchange record, it could lead to inconsistent data states.
: The error message construction in the
block could be improved for clarity and completeness.

could lead to issues if not consistently managed across the system.
: As the system grows, the procedure may need optimization to handle larger volumes of data efficiently.
: Ensure that the procedure is executed with appropriate permissions to prevent unauthorized data modifications.

--**************************************************************************************
--* Description:	"46" Identify the existing account to which a new meter is to be added
--*               
--* Parameter(s):        
--*		@AuthenticatedUserID int		- the seqid of the user that runs the stored procedure	
--*     @ExchangeSeqid   int			- The sequence id of the exchange record to be processed
--*     @ExchangeCode varchar(2)		- The exchange code of the exchange record to be processed,
--*											it should be a "46" for this procedure.
--*		@CurrentBillingPeriod			
--*     @StatusCode  int output			- Execution Return Status 
--*
--*
--* Return:	0 Success
--*         1 Failure
--*
--* AUTHOR:       MOHAMMED BELARREM
--* Created On:   05/07/2012
--**************************************************************************************
--* Date       Tech Description of Change
--* ---------- ---	-------------------------------------------------------------
--* 05/07/2012 MB   First Version  
--* 11/29/2016	zd	turn off date 9999 99 99 to 99991231
--* 01/28/2019  VY  Updated for UniqueAccountSeqID
--***************************************************************************************
CREATE PROCEDURE [ManualBill].[usp_ManualBillingAddNewMeter]
(
	@ReviewerAuthenticatedUserID AS INT,
	@ExchangeSeqid AS INT,
	@ExchangeCode AS VARCHAR(2),
	@CurrentBillingPeriod AS VARCHAR(6),
	@StatusCode AS INT OUTPUT
)
AS
BEGIN
	SET NOCOUNT ON;
				
	DECLARE @AccountNumber AS VARCHAR(15), @MeterNumber AS VARCHAR(12), @AccountSeqid AS INT
		,@AgencySeqid AS INT,@FacilitySeqid AS INT, @AccountEffectiveTurnOn AS VARCHAR(8)
		,@AccountEffectiveTurnOff AS VARCHAR(8), @RecordExchangeCode AS VARCHAR(2);
		
	-- do some validation 
	-- CHECK IF THE record exists
	IF (NOT EXISTS (SELECT ExchangeDataSeqid FROM ManualBill.ManualBillingExchangeData WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid))
	BEGIN
		RAISERROR ('The ExchangeDataSeqid %i does not exist. Please verify. ', 12, 1, @ExchangeSeqid) 
		SET @StatusCode = 1
		RETURN;
	END;

	-- check if the record was processed
	IF ('Y' = (SELECT IsProcessed FROM ManualBill.ManualBillingExchangeData WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid))
	BEGIN
		RAISERROR ('This exchange was already processed. exchangeseqid %i ', 12, 1, @ExchangeSeqid) 
		SET @StatusCode = 1
		RETURN;
	END;

	SELECT 
		@AccountSeqid = AccountSeqid,
		@MeterNumber = CurrentMeterNumber,
		@RecordExchangeCode	= ExchangeCode			
	FROM ManualBill.ManualBillingExchangeData
	WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;
		
	-- check the obvious
	IF (@ExchangeCode <> '46' or @ExchangeCode <> @RecordExchangeCode)
	BEGIN
		RAISERROR ('The exchange code is not 46. Please verify: account seqid %d and meter number %s ', 12, 1, @AccountSeqid, @MeterNumber) 
		SET @StatusCode = 1
		RETURN;
	END;
		
	-- check if the current account number is already in the system
	IF (NOT EXISTS(SELECT * FROM Billing.Account WHERE AccountSeqid = @AccountSeqid AND AccountStatus IN ('AC', '46')))
	BEGIN
		RAISERROR ('The account does not exist in the system under an active status. Please verify: account Seqid %d ', 12, 1, @AccountSeqid) 
		SET @StatusCode = 1
		RETURN;
	END;

	-- Check if the new meter EXISTS
	IF (EXISTS(SELECT * FROM Billing.Meter WHERE OriginalMeterNumber = @MeterNumber AND CurrentMeterNumber = @MeterNumber))
	BEGIN
		RAISERROR ('The meter number in the exchange %s exists already in the system. Please verify', 12, 1, @MeterNumber) 
		SET @StatusCode = 1
		RETURN;
	END;
		
	BEGIN TRY
		BEGIN TRANSACTION NewMeterExchange;
		SET @StatusCode  = 0;
		
		DECLARE @NewMeterStatus VARCHAR(2), @PreviousMeterStatus VARCHAR(2), @EnergySource INT, @UtilitySeqid INT
			,@NewMeterSeqid INT, @UniqueAccountSeqID INT;
				
		SELECT @NewMeterStatus = '46', @PreviousMeterStatus	= 'N6';
			
		-- Get some account information
		SELECT @FacilitySeqid = FacilityAccount
			,@AccountNumber = CurrentAccountNumber
			,@AgencySeqid = AgencyAccount
			,@UtilitySeqid = UtilityAccountProvider
			,@EnergySource = EnergyAccountDescription
			,@AccountEffectiveTurnOn = AccountEffectiveTurnOn
			,@AccountEffectiveTurnOff = AccountEffectiveTurnOff
			,@UniqueAccountSeqID = UniqueAccountSeqID
		FROM Billing.Account
		WHERE AccountSeqid = @AccountSeqid;
			
		-- insert the new meter number
		INSERT INTO Billing.Meter
			(UniqueAccountSeqID
			,UtilityServiceAddress
			,OriginalAccountNumber
			,CurrentMeterNumber
			,OriginalMeterNumber
			,Tension
			,IsOECDefinedMeter
			,IsUploadProcessed
			,IsMeterUsageTracked
			,EnergySource
			,EnergyAccountDescription
			,MeterStatus
			,MeterPreviousStatus
			,MeterStatusCodePeriod
			,AssociatedDemandMeter
			,AgencyELOMeterLocation
			,UtilityAddressMeterLocation
			,MeterSquareFootageCoverage
			,TurnOnDate
			,TurnOffDate
			,MeterEffectiveOnDate
			,MeterEffectiveOffDate
			,MeterType
			,MeterDials
			,MeterConstant
			,LastPeriodOriginalBilled
			,LastPeriodAdjustmentBilled
			,LastZeroUsageBillingPeriod
			,AdjustmentRecordSeqid
			,Notes
			,AuthenticatedUserID
			,DateAdded
			,LastUpdate)
		SELECT
			@UniqueAccountSeqID										--- UniqueAccountSeqID, added on 1/18/2019
			,AccountAddress		   									--- UtilityServiceAddress                             
			,@AccountNumber  										--- OriginalAccountNumber                                                                                
			,CurrentMeterNumber       								--- CurrentMeterNumber         
			,CurrentMeterNumber										--- OriginalMeterNumber         
			,null	                   								--- Tension 
			,'N'	                   								--- IsOECDefinedMeter 
			,'Y'	                   								--- IsUploadProcessed 
			,'N'	                   								--- IsMeterUsageTracked 
			,@EnergySource	           								--- EnergySource         
			,@EnergySource	           								--- EnergyAccountDescription         
			,@NewMeterStatus	       								--- MeterStatus             
			,@PreviousMeterStatus	   								--- MeterPreviousStatus                 
			,@CurrentBillingPeriod    								--- MeterStatusCodePeriod                  
			,null	                   								--- AssociatedDemandMeter 
			,NULL 	                   								--- AgencyELOMeterLocation 
			,NULL 	                   								--- UtilityAddressMeterLocation 
			,NULL 	                   								--- MeterSquareFootageCoverage 
			,@CurrentBillingPeriod	   								--- TurnOnDate                 
			,'999912'	               								--- TurnOffDate     
			,dbo.ConvertDatetimeToYYYYMMDD(MeterEffectiveTurnOnDate)--- MeterEffectiveOnDate                    
			,'99991231'	           									--- MeterEffectiveOffDate         
			,NULL		               								--- MeterType     
			,0				          								--- MeterDials         
			,0	           											--- MeterConstant         
			,NULL	                   								--- LastPeriodOriginalBilled 
			,NULL	                   								--- LastPeriodAdjustmentBilled 
			,NULL	                   								--- LastZeroUsageBillingPeriod 
			,NULL	   	               								--- AdjustmentRecordSeqid                                                              
			,NULL 	                   								--- Notes 
			,@ReviewerAuthenticatedUserID	   						--- AuthenticatedUserID                 
			,getDate()	               								--- DateAdded     
			,getDate()	               								--- LastUpdate     
		FROM ManualBill.ManualBillingExchangeData
		WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;

		--	Find new sequence id and save it for insertion into the AccountExchangeMeterTrack and the new @CurrentMeterNumber
		SELECT @NewMeterSeqid  = ident_current('Billing.Meter');
				
		-- insert the accountExchangeTrackMeter
		INSERT INTO Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack
			(UniqueAccountSeqID
			,UtilityCompanySeqid
			,OriginalAgencyDivisionSeqid
			,OriginalFacilitySeqid
			,OriginalAccountSeqid
			,OriginalMeterSeqid
			,OriginalAccountNumber
			,OriginalMeterNumber
			,AccountEffectiveBillingStartDate
			,AccountEffectiveBillingEndDate
			,MeterEffectiveBillingStartDate
			,MeterEffectiveBillingEndDate
			,AuthenticatedUserID
			,DateAdded
			,LastUpdate)
		SELECT  
			@UniqueAccountSeqID
			,@UtilitySeqid
			,@AgencySeqid
			,@FacilitySeqid
			,@AccountSeqid
			,@NewMeterSeqid
			,@AccountNumber
			,CurrentMeterNumber 
			,@AccountEffectiveTurnOn
			,@AccountEffectiveTurnOff
			,dbo.ConvertDatetimeToYYYYMMDD(MeterEffectiveTurnOnDate)
			,'99991231'
			,@ReviewerAuthenticatedUserID
			,getDate()
			,getDate()
		FROM ManualBill.ManualBillingExchangeData
		WHERE   ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;
	
		-- all went well commit
		commit TRAN NewMeterExchange;
				
		UPDATE ManualBill.ManualBillingExchangeData
		SET IsProcessed = 'Y', ReviewerAuthenticatedUserID = @ReviewerAuthenticatedUserID
		WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;
	END TRY
	BEGIN CATCH
		DECLARE @ExchangeErrorMessage AS NVARCHAR(4000), @ErrorMessage AS NVARCHAR(4000), @ErrorSeverity AS INT
			,@ErrorState AS INT, @ErrorNumber AS INT, @ErrorLine AS INT, @ErrorProcedure AS NVARCHAR(126), @crlf AS VARCHAR(2);

		SET @crlf = CHAR(13) + CHAR(10);
		SET @ErrorMessage = @ExchangeErrorMessage + @ErrorMessage+@crlf + '@ErrorNumber: ' + CAST(@ErrorNumber AS VARCHAR(10)) + @crlf;

		SELECT 
			@ExchangeErrorMessage ='Error in StoredProcedure %s at line number %d'+@crlf+'Billing Period: %s'+@crlf+'Exchange Sequence Id:%d'+@crlf+'Account:Meter (%s : %s)  '+@crlf,
			@ErrorMessage = ERROR_MESSAGE(),
			@ErrorSeverity = ERROR_SEVERITY(),
			@ErrorState = ERROR_STATE(),
			@ErrorNumber = ERROR_NUMBER(),
			@ErrorProcedure = ERROR_PROCEDURE(),
			@ErrorLine = ERROR_LINE();			
		
		RAISERROR (@ErrorMessage, @ErrorSeverity, @ErrorState, @ErrorProcedure, @ErrorLine, @CurrentBillingPeriod
			,@ExchangeSeqid, @AccountNumber, @AccountNumber) WITH LOG;				
		
		SET @StatusCode  = 1;
				
		ROLLBACK tran NewMeterExchange;
	END CATCH;
END;
